example: Croquet ?

definition: In a predominant manner. Most commonly or frequently by a large margin.

definition: mischievous; excessively playful.

example: We're just saying the Unsubs are sophisticated enough to study other crimes.

definition: Renewed pursuit, or cultivation, or flourishing state of something, as of commerce, arts, agriculture.

definition: To give (something) a meaning or an importance.

example: He has since served as chairman and currently as trustee for the foundation.
example_meaning: Ông đã từng là chủ tịch và hiện là người được ủy thác cho quỹ này.
definition: A person to whom property is legally committed in trust, to be applied either for the benefit of specified individuals, or for public uses; one who is intrusted with property for the benefit of another; also, a person in whose hands the effects of another are attached in a trustee process.

example: The ancient Sumerians in Mesopotamia used a complex system of canals and levees to divert water from the Tigris and Euphrates rivers for irrigation.
example_meaning: Người Sumer cổ đại ở Mesopotamia đã sử dụng một hệ thống kênh và đê phức tạp để chuyển nước từ sông Tigris và sông Euphrates để tưới tiêu.
definition: An embankment to prevent inundation; as, the levees along the Mississippi.

example: ... and a loaf for Matron , please.
example_meaning: Và một ổ bánh mì cho bà Quản lý , làm ơn.
definition: A mature woman; a wife or a widow, especially, one who has borne children; a woman of staid or motherly manners.

example: Jut overpreparing for a hearing.

definition: something that sticks out

example_meaning: Nếu theo ông Lindsay, thì chúng ta nên luôn luôn sẵn sàng ứng chiến.
definition: Seeming to never end; endlessly; constantly.

definition: a way of speaking slowly while lengthening vowel sounds and running words together. Characteristic of some southern US accents, as well as Scots.

definition: (obsolete) spark

example: I must say, they were a little miffed at you for borrowing their cipher.
example_meaning: Phải nói là, họ hơi phật ý về việc anh mượn đỡ bản mật mã của họ.
definition: Simple past tense and past participle of miff.

example: A censor does only what his work is.
example_meaning: Một nhân viên kiểm duyệt chỉ làm nhiệm vụ của mình.
definition: (history) A Roman magistrate, originally a census administrator, by Classical times a high judge of public behavior and morality

example: There's enough space and ventilation to accommodate an embalming suite.
example_meaning: Có đủ không gian và thoáng mát để chứa một bộ máy ướp xác.

definition: The act of persuading, or trying to do so; the addressing of arguments to someone with the intention of changing their mind or convincing them of a certain point of view, course of action etc. [from 14th c.]

example: Yet, that car sits idle for 23 hours a day.
example_meaning: Tuy nhiên, chiếc xe đó chỉ ngổi đó nhàn rỗi trong 23 giờ một ngày.
definition: (obsolete) Empty, vacant.

example: As opposed to your seedy motel?

definition: An object (now especially a small disc) used in counting or keeping count, or as a marker in games, etc.

example: But no, just the mechanics stabilized the gait , and the robot doesn't fall over.
example_meaning: Không, chỉ các cơ chế đã giữ dáng đi ổn định, và con robot không bị ngã xuống.

definition: A glass vessel or bottle, especially a small bottle used to store medicine or perfume.

example_meaning: Đây là một cái sofa 4.000 đô bọc bằng lụa Ý!

example: I dress from head to toe in a black hijab .
example_meaning: Một bộ đồ hijab đen từ đầu đến chân
definition: (uncountable) (Islam) the practice, when beyond the age of puberty, of dressing modestly (especially for women).

example: The first phrase, the entire section, must be played staccato .
example_meaning: Câu đầu tiên, cả trường đoạn, phải chơi âm bén , rời .
definition: (music) An articulation marking directing that a note or passage of notes are to be played in an abruptly disconnected manner, with each note sounding for a very short duration, and a short break lasting until the sounding of the next note; as opposed to legato. Staccato is indicated by a dot directly above or below the notehead.
